spiritsExplanation: The workout titled '80's Fun Summer Row' predominantly embodies the 'Flow & Rhythm' spirit. This is supported by the use of 80's music which suggests a synchronized, rhythm-driven experience. Songs listed are well-known for their upbeat and catchy rhythm, aligning with the 'Flow & Rhythm' category, hence a score of 0.75. The use of intervals, specifically four-minute and 45-second sets at a maximum rhythm of 30, indicates a strong engagement with continuous movement and coordination enhanced by music.\nThe workout also shows elements of 'High-Energy & Intense'. Despite the description suggesting relaxation, the format involves interval training with intentions for sweating. The workout's intensity level is 2 out of 3, indicating a fairly challenging experience. These aspects justify an assignment of 0.65 to 'High-Energy & Intense'. \nThe 'Structured & Disciplined' spirit was not emphasized due to a less methodical approach implied by the title and description, focusing on excitement and rhythm rather than technical precision. The absence of indicators of 'Nature', 'Sports-Specificity', or 'Recovery' leads to the exclusion of other spirits.
